fields.description: This is when the person asks another court to look at the case again.
fields.name: Appeal

fields.description: To promise.
fields.name: To Affirm

fields.description: When the police take someone to the police station because they think they may have done a crime. They have the right to a lawyer to help them.
fields.name: Arrest

fields.description: A check that is done to see what you need.
fields.name: Assessment

fields.description: Being allowed out of prison until you have to go back to court, if a judge thinks that you will go back when you should. Sometimes you might need to go to a police station every day or stay in at night time.
fields.name: Bail

fields.description: When you tell the police about a crime, everything about that crime is called the case. It will have a number which you will be given.
fields.name: Case

fields.description: When the police officially tell a person whicy lawy they think they have broken.
fields.name: Charge

fields.description: It is money you get if you lose something, have problems or are injured and it is not your fault.
fields.name: Compensation

fields.description: When a person breaks the law.
fields.name: Crime

fields.description: All the services involved in law, crime and punishment working together.
fields.name: Criminal Justice system

fields.description: This service decides how to charge someone for a crime and take the person to court.
fields.name: Crown prosecution service

fields.description: You or a lawyer saying why you did or didn’t do something.
fields.name: Defense

fields.description: Information that can be used to try and prove something.
fields.name: Evidence

fields.description: A police officer who is trained to support you and be a link to the police.
fields.name: Family Liaison officer

fields.description: When a court decided that you did something wrong.
fields.name: Guilty

fields.description: Where you are taken to another country and used for sex, as a slave or something else illegal.
fields.name: Human trafficking

fields.description: When the police look at the facts and try to find out what happened.
fields.name: Investigation

fields.description: They look into complaints that people have been treated unfairly or have received poor service from government departments and other public organisations and the NHS in England.
fields.name: Parliamentary and Health Service Ombudsman

fields.description: This service checks a prisoner does things like training, getting treatment or helping in the community when they leave prison.
fields.name: Probation Service

fields.description: The lawyer who tries to show someone did a crime.
fields.name: Prosecutor

fields.description: What happens to someone who breaks the law. For example, if the court sends them to prison.
fields.name: Punishment

fields.description: People that help you understand questions you are asked and help you give your answers.
fields.name: Registered Intermediaries

fields.description: Which means trying to make things better for the victim instead of just punishing someone for a crime.
fields.name: Restorative justice

fields.description: The punishment you get in court.
fields.name: Sentence

fields.description: They depend on what you need to give the best evidence you can, but can include video link or a screen.
fields.name: Special measures

fields.description: Someone who speaks for a group of people.
fields.name: Spokesperson

fields.description: The support you can get and how you should be treated from when you first tell the police about a crime to after it has gone to court.
fields.name: Standards

fields.description: Writing down what really happened. Someone else can write this down for you and if you agree you have to sign it. You can't take back the statement once you have signed it, but you can give a new version.
fields.name: Statement

fields.description: Someone the police think broke the law.
fields.name: Suspect

fields.description: Being made to feel afraid someone will hurt or upset you.
fields.name: Threatened

fields.description: To promise by putting your hand on a holy book like the bible or other religion.
fields.name: To swear

fields.description: When a case goes to court and the court decides if the person is guilty of the crime.
fields.name: Trial

fields.description: A person who is harmed because of a crime.
fields.name: Victim

fields.description: You can ask that the court hear about how the crime affected you. This won't affect the verdict, but may change how bad the punishment is. The police or the witness care unit can take your statement.
fields.name: Victim Personal Statement

fields.description: Court Staff that will come and show you where to go when in court.
fields.name: Usher

fields.description: Someone who is at greater risk of being taken advantage of.
fields.name: Vulnerable

fields.description: Someone who can tell the court what happened.
fields.name: Witness

fields.description: A court paper saying you must go to court to give evidence.
fields.name: Witness summons
